verses.esv:
10   “Be still, and know that I am God.
    I will be exalted among the nations,
    I will be exalted in the earth!”
verses.kjv: 10 Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.
verses.niv: 10 "Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth."

verses.esv:
28   Even a fool who keeps silent is considered wise;
    when he closes his lips, he is deemed intelligent.
verses.kjv: 28 Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
verses.niv: 28 Even a fool is thought wise if he keeps silent, and discerning if he holds his tongue.

verses.esv:
5   For God alone, O my soul, wait in silence,
    for my hope is from him.
verses.kjv: 5 My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
verses.niv: 5 Find rest, O my soul, in God alone; my hope comes from him.

verses.esv:
26   It is good that one should wait quietly
    for the salvation of the LORD.
verses.kjv: 26 It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the LORD.
verses.niv: 26 it is good to wait quietly for the salvation of the LORD.

verses.esv:
3   Set a guard, O LORD, over my mouth;
    keep watch over the door of my lips!
verses.kjv: 3 Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
verses.niv: 3 Set a guard over my mouth, O LORD; keep watch over the door of my lips.

verses.esv: 14 The LORD will fight for you, and you have only to be silent.”
verses.kjv: 14 The LORD shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
verses.niv: 14 The LORD will fight for you; you need only to be still."

verses.esv:
20   But the LORD is in his holy temple;
    let all the earth keep silence before him.”
verses.kjv: 20 But the LORD is in his holy temple: let all the earth keep silence before him.
verses.niv: 20 But the LORD is in his holy temple; let all the earth be silent before him."

verses.esv: 11 Let a woman learn quietly with all submissiveness. 12 I do not permit a woman to teach or to exercise authority over a man; rather, she is to remain quiet. 13 For Adam was formed first, then Eve; 14 and Adam was not deceived, but the woman was deceived and became a transgressor.
verses.kjv: 11 Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection. 12 But I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to usurp authority over the man, but to be in silence. 13 For Adam was first formed, then Eve. 14 And Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived was in the transgression.
verses.niv: 11 A woman should learn in quietness and full submission. 12 I do not permit a woman to teach or to have authority over a man; she must be silent. 13 For Adam was formed first, then Eve. 14 And Adam was not the one deceived; it was the woman who was deceived and became a sinner.

verses.esv:
21   “Men listened to me and waited
    and kept silence for my counsel.
verses.kjv: 21 Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.
verses.niv: 21 "Men listened to me expectantly, waiting in silence for my counsel.

verses.esv:
11   A fool gives full vent to his spirit,
    but a wise man quietly holds it back.
verses.kjv: 11 A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.
verses.niv: 11 A fool gives full vent to his anger, but a wise man keeps himself under control.

verses.esv: 8:1 When the Lamb opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.
verses.kjv: 1 And when he had opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven about the space of half an hour.
verses.niv: 1 When he opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.

verses.esv:
7   Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for him;
    fret not yourself over the one who prospers in his way,
    over the man who carries out evil devices!
verses.kjv: 7 Rest in the LORD, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.
verses.niv: 7 Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for him; do not fret when men succeed in their ways, when they carry out their wicked schemes.

verses.esv:
7   He was oppressed, and he was afflicted,
    yet he opened not his mouth;
  like a lamb that is led to the slaughter,
    and like a sheep that before its shearers is silent,
    so he opened not his mouth.
verses.kjv: 7 He was oppressed, and he was afflicted, yet he opened not his mouth: he is brought as a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is dumb, so he openeth not his mouth.
verses.niv: 7 He was oppressed and afflicted, yet he did not open his mouth; he was led like a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is silent, so he did not open his mouth.

verses.esv: 34 the women should keep silent in the churches. For they are not permitted to speak, but should be in submission, as the Law also says. 35 If there is anything they desire to learn, let them ask their husbands at home. For it is shameful for a woman to speak in church.
verses.kjv: 34 Let your women keep silence in the churches: for it is not permitted unto them to speak; but they are commanded to be under obedience, as also saith the law. 35 And if they will learn any thing, let them ask their husbands at home: for it is a shame for women to speak in the church.
verses.niv: 34 As in all the congregations of the saints, women should remain silent in the churches. They are not allowed to speak, but must be in submission, as the Law says. 35 If they want to inquire about something, they should ask their own husbands at home; for it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in the church.

verses.esv:
28   Let him sit alone in silence
    when it is laid on him;
verses.kjv: 28 He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.
verses.niv: 28 Let him sit alone in silence, for the LORD has laid it on him.

verses.esv: 17 So faith comes from hearing, and hearing through the word of Christ.
verses.kjv: 17 So then faith cometh by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.
verses.niv: 17 Consequently, faith comes from hearing the message, and the message is heard through the word of Christ.

verses.esv:
13   If one gives an answer before he hears,
    it is his folly and shame.
verses.kjv: 13 He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.
verses.niv: 13 He who answers before listening- that is his folly and his shame.

verses.esv:
15   For thus said the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel,
  “In returning and rest you shall be saved;
    in quietness and in trust shall be your strength.”
  But you were unwilling,
verses.kjv: 15 For thus saith the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not.
verses.niv: 15 This is what the Sovereign LORD, the Holy One of Israel, says: "In repentance and rest is your salvation, in quietness and trust is your strength, but you would have none of it.

verses.esv:
7   a time to tear, and a time to sew;
  a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;
verses.kjv: 7 A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;
verses.niv: 7 a time to tear and a time to mend, a time to be silent and a time to speak,

verses.esv: 19 Know this, my beloved brothers: let every person be quick to hear, slow to speak, slow to anger;
verses.kjv: 19 Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:
verses.niv: 19 My dear brothers, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry,

verses.esv:
To the choirmaster: according to Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.

62:1   For God alone my soul waits in silence;
    from him comes my salvation.
verses.kjv: 1 Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.
verses.niv: 1 My soul finds rest in God alone; my salvation comes from him.

verses.esv:
6   A fool’s lips walk into a fight,
    and his mouth invites a beating.
7   A fool’s mouth is his ruin,
    and his lips are a snare to his soul.
verses.kjv: 6 A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes. 7 A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.
verses.niv: 6 A fool's lips bring him strife, and his mouth invites a beating. 7 A fool's mouth is his undoing, and his lips are a snare to his soul.

verses.esv:
3   Set a guard, O LORD, over my mouth;
    keep watch over the door of my lips!
4   Do not let my heart incline to any evil,
    to busy myself with wicked deeds
  in company with men who work iniquity,
    and let me not eat of their delicacies!
verses.kjv: 3 Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips. 4 Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.
verses.niv: 3 Set a guard over my mouth, O LORD; keep watch over the door of my lips. 4 Let not my heart be drawn to what is evil, to take part in wicked deeds with men who are evildoers; let me not eat of their delicacies.

verses.esv:
23   A prudent man conceals knowledge,
    but the heart of fools proclaims folly.
verses.kjv: 23 A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.
verses.niv: 23 A prudent man keeps his knowledge to himself, but the heart of fools blurts out folly.

verses.esv:
23   Whoever keeps his mouth and his tongue
    keeps himself out of trouble.
verses.kjv: 23 Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
verses.niv: 23 He who guards his mouth and his tongue keeps himself from calamity.
